### Helicopter Charter Services for Parks Canada National Fire Management Program

#### Reference Number: PW-23-01023931

Parks Canada intends to award a contract for Helicopter Charter Services under the National Fire Management Program within Wood Buffalo National Park. The services required include:

- Safe, rapid, and reliable water delivery for wildland fire management
- Transportation of Parks Canada personnel and equipment in a safe and reliable manner
- Performance of specialized fire management operations, including vertical reference work, ignition operations, and fire mapping
- Support for other park management operations, such as resource management, wildlife management, visitor safety, law enforcement, and asset management

#### Contract Period
The contract period will commence on the date of the contract and is expected to end on March 31, 2025, inclusive. The Contractor may be granted an option to extend the term for an additional one-year period from April 1, 2025, to March 31, 2026, under the same conditions.

#### Technical and Contractual Enquiries
Enquiries of a technical and contractual nature should be submitted to the Contracting Authority. All enquiries must be submitted in writing and should be received no later than seven calendar days prior to the scheduled closing date to allow sufficient time for response.

#### Tender Details
The solicitation document and all addenda will be available on the Government Electronic Tendering Service at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca). Bidders must submit their bids via Fax or Email. Bids received in-person or by courier will not be accepted. The only acceptable Email address for responses to the bid solicitation is [soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca](mailto:soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca).

#### Contact Information

Contact Andrea McGraw Alcock at:

Email: [andrea.mcgraw-alcock@pc.gc.ca](mailto:andrea.mcgraw-alcock@pc.gc.ca)
Phone: 587 436 5908
Fax: 866 246 6893

_[National Parks Regulations](https://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/fra/loi/9-35/page-1.html) must be adhered to._
